adp.aufgabe10

Class HashTable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • adp.aufgabe10.HashTable<T>

  • public class HashTable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An (almost) generic HashTable that can store generic Data associated with a String as key.
    Version:
    1.0 - 03.12.2016
    Author:
    Moritz HÃ¶wer

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  HashTable.HashTableEntry<X>
      Member class for storing metadata (key and deleted flag) alongside actual data in the HashTable

      cache for the entry count (saved 90% of execution time)

      the initial capacity of the HashTable.
      private static double LOADFACTOR_THRESHOLD
      threshold at which to expand the underlying array [0-1]
      private static int OFFSET
      offset is used to limit ASCI code range to sensible characters in Hash function
      private PrimeFinder pf
      reusing PrimeFinder from Aufgabe 2 to ensure size is always a prime.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashTable

        public HashTable()

      • HashTable

        public HashTable(int capacity)

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String key,
                T value)
        Stores a value (associated with a key) in this HashTable. Calling put twice with the same key (same as in key1.equals(key2) == true) results in the first value being overwritten by the second one.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used for referencing the value
        value - the value to be stored

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of this HashTable (how many elements are stored).
        Returns:
        the number of keys / values stored

      • getKeys

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getKeys()
        Goes through the HashTable and returns a List that contains all the keys in no particular order.
        Returns:
        List of all keys

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks whether a given key is stored in the HashTable.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to check
        Returns:
        true, if key is stored in the HashTable

      • get

        public T get(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves the value associated with key from the HashTable. Key must be part of the HashTable, containsKey(String) can be used to check beforehand.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to look up.
        Returns:
        the value associated with the key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is not stored in the HashTable.

      • enlargeHashTable

        private void enlargeHashTable()
        Increases the size of the HashTable. Finds the first prime that is at least 1.5 times as large as the current size and creates a new HashTable with that capacity. Then all values from the current HashTable are inserted into the new one. Finally, the HashTable takes over the state (data Array and entryCount) of the other HashTable which is then left to be Garbage collected.

      • hash

        private int hash(java.lang.String value)
        Generates a hash from the String. Every character has value BASE^(position in String). BASE is basically the 7 bit ASCII code, but values 0 - 32 (SPACE) are cut off, because they are control characters. The characters value is then multiplied by the offset from SPACE.
        Parameters:
        value - the String to hash
        Returns:
        the hash of the String (mapped to fit within the boundaries of the HashTable)

      • probeHash

        private int probeHash(int hash)
        Returns probe jump width based on a hash, mapped to be at most 2/3 of the length of the HashTable. Eliminating the call to hash() in this function saved a ton of execution time. Usually the probe is calculated based on the key, but by caching the hash outside this function, it's much faster.
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash to calculate probe based on
        Returns:
        the probe step width for the given hash

      • getLoadFactor

        private double getLoadFactor()
        Calculates the load factor (occupied / capacity).
        Returns:
        the load factor [0-1]

      • checkHashCollisionOn

        private boolean checkHashCollisionOn(int index,
                                     java.lang.String key)
        Checks if there was a hash collision.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to check
        key - the key to check against
        Returns:
        true, if index is not supposed to be pointed to by key

      • getIndexForKey

        private int getIndexForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the index in the HashTable where the value associated with key is stored or supposed to be stored.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to check
        Returns:
        the index key points to in the HashTable.

      • indexOf

        private java.util.OptionalInt indexOf(java.lang.String key)
        Returns an OptionalInt that contains the index pointed to by key, if one such index exists.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to check.
        Returns:
        empty Optional if key doesn't exist in HashTable, otherwise index pointed to by key wrapped in an Optional.
